fieldDescription: Set this to false to completely disable all terraforming content regardless of other settings.
Controls how long planet type change projects take (in days).
Controls how long resource improvement projects take (in days).
Controls how long condition improvement projects take (in days).

fieldName: Add volatiles to Terran and tundra worlds
fieldDescription: Set this to false to prevent Terran and tundra type change projects from creating volatiles deposits.
Set this to true to enable the terraforming project to remove radiation from a market.
Set this to true to enable the terraforming project to remove the atmosphere from a market.
Set this to false to disable the Stellar Reflector Array building.

Set this to false to prevent certain markets from starting the game with the Stellar Reflector Array building already constructed.

If set to false, Eventide, Eochu Bres and certain other markets will get to keep their Solar Array market condition for free without needing to maintain the Stellar Reflector Building.
Set this to false to disable the Genelab building.
Set this to false to disable the Mesozoic Park building.

Set this to false to disable the Domed Cities building.

Also controls whether the Seafloor Cities building is enabled or disabled.
Set this to false to remove the defense penalty from the Domed Cities building.

Set this to true to enable the Harmonic Damper building.

The Harmonic Damper building suppresses tectonic activity market conditions.

Set this to true to enable the Planetary Agrav Field building.

The Planetary Agrav Field building supresses high and low gravity market conditions if the Domed Cities building is present on the colony.

Set this to true to enable the Magnetoshield building.

The Magnetoshield building will suppress the irradiated market condition.

Set this to true to enable the Planet Cracker building.

The Planet Cracker building can be constructed on a station orbiting a planet. It will permanently improve ore and rare ore resources on that planet by one level but will add the tectonic activity market condition. Does nothing if the planet already has tectonic activity.

Set this to true to enable the Ouyang Optimizer building.

The Ouyang Optimizer building can be constructed on a station orbiting a gas giant. It will permanently improve volatiles resources on that planet by one level but will add the extreme weather market condition. Does nothing if the planet already has extreme weather.
Set this to false to completely disable all station construction content regardless of other settings.
Set this to true to cause station construction to take the specified number of days instead of completing instantly.
If the station construction delay is enabled this controls how many days it will take to complete.
Adds an accessibility modifier to player-constructed stations. Negative values can be used to decrease accessibility.
Adds a hazard modifier to player-constructed stations. Negative values can be used to decrease hazard.

Applies Cramped Quarters (if enabled), applies hazard and accessibility modifiers, and enables 'no atmosphere' special items on all stations sector-wide.

If set to false, only stations created using Terraforming & Station Construction will have the above features applied to them.

Set this to true to enable the AI Mining Drones building.

Can be built on station markets to increase mining yields. Balanced around Cramped Quarters also being enabled.

Set this to true to enable the Cramped Quarters condition.

Cramped Quarters reduces population growth on station markets starting from the value chosen below.

fieldName: Cramped Quarters growth penalty market size
fieldDescription: If Cramped Quarters is enabled this setting controls at what market size the growth penalty begins to apply.

If Cramped Quarters is enabled this setting controls how significant the growth penalty is.

Note that the penalty will become more severe as the station grows beyond the base size at which the penalty began applying.

Set this to true to enable the Expand Station building.

The Expand Station building will increase the base level at which the Cramped Quarters growth penalty begins to apply.

Set this to false to disable the progressive cost increase for the Expand Station building.

By default, the Expand Station building will cost more each time it is built after the first time on a given station market.

Set this to false to disable construction of astropolis stations.

Astropolis stations can be constructed using an ability when the player is close to a planet they have already colonized. The station will orbit the planet and have a separate market from the market on the colony. Astropolis stations have no resource deposits.

fieldName: Maximum number of astropolis stations per planet
fieldDescription:
Controls how many astropolis stations can be constructed in orbit around a single planet.

Large numbers will look very silly.

fieldName: Astropolis stations can be built on purchased planets
fieldDescription: Set this to true to allow astropolis stations to be constructed in orbit around planets where the player purchased governorship.

Set this to false to allow construction of astropolis stations in orbit around planets that otherwise do not meet the criteria for astropolis construction.

The criteria for astropolis construction are factors like the size of the planet, other planets or moons orbiting close to it, etc.
How many credits are required to construct an astropolis station.
How many crew are required to construct an astropolis station.

fieldName: Astropolis station heavy machinery build cost
fieldDescription: How much heavy machinery is required to construct an astropolis station.
How much metal is required to construct an astropolis station.
How much transplutonic metal is required to construct an astropolis station.

Controls which sprite(s) are used for astropolis stations.

Zero means the sprites for astropolis stations rotate between low tech, midline and high tech. One makes astropolis stations use exclusively low tech sprites, two is for midline sprites and three is for high tech sprites.

Set this to false to disable construction of mining stations.

Mining stations can be constructed using an ability when the player is in an asteroid field or asteroid belt. Mining stations have ore and rare ore resource deposits.

Controls how many mining stations can be constructed per system.

This value can be arbitrarily large but balance and performance problems will occur if too many colonies are in the same system.

fieldName: Link mining resources to number of fields/belts
fieldDescription: Set this to true to link the ore and rare ore resource deposits on mining stations to the number of asteroid belts and fields present in the system.

fieldName: Number of belts/fields required for sparse ore deposits
fieldDescription: How many asteroid fields and/or asteroid belts are required in the system for mining stations to have at least sparse ore deposits.

fieldName: Number of belts/fields required for moderate ore deposits
fieldDescription: How many asteroid fields and/or asteroid belts are required in the system for mining stations to have at least moderate ore deposits.

fieldName: Number of belts/fields required for abundant ore deposits
fieldDescription: How many asteroid fields and/or asteroid belts are required in the system for mining stations to have at least abundant ore deposits.

fieldName: Number of belts/fields required for rich ore deposits
fieldDescription: How many asteroid fields and/or asteroid belts are required in the system for mining stations to have at least rich ore deposits.

fieldName: Number of belts/fields required for ultrarich ore deposits
fieldDescription: How many asteroid fields and/or asteroid belts are required in the system for mining stations to have at least ultra rich ore deposits.

If the setting to link mining station resource deposits to the number of asteroid belts and fields in the system is set to false, this controls the amount of the resource deposits on mining stations.

1 = Sparse, 2 = Moderate, 3 = Abundant, 4 = Rich, 5 = Ultrarich, Any other value = set to moderate
How many credits are required to construct a mining station.
How many crew are required to construct a mining station.

fieldName: Mining station heavy machinery build cost
fieldDescription: How much heavy machinery is required to construct a mining station.
How much metal is required to construct a mining station.
How much transplutonic metal is required to construct a mining station.

Set this to false to disable construction of siphon stations.

Siphon stations can be constructed using an ability when the player is near a gas giant. Siphon stations have volatiles resource deposits.

fieldName: Link siphon station volatiles to gas giant
fieldDescription:
By default, siphon station volatiles resource deposits are the same level as the gas giant the station orbits.

Toggling this to false will cause siphon stations to have a static amount of volatiles instead.

If the setting to link siphon station volatiles deposits to the gas giant the station is orbiting is set to false, this controls the amount of the volatiles resource deposit on the station.

1 = Trace, 2 = Diffuse, 3 = Abundant, 4 = Plentiful, Any other value = set to diffuse
How many credits are required to construct a siphon station.
How many crew are required to construct a siphon station.

fieldName: Siphon station heavy machinery build cost
fieldDescription: How much heavy machinery is required to construct a siphon station.
How much metal is required to construct a siphon station.
How much transplutonic metal is required to construct a siphon station.

Set this to false to disable station recolonization.

Certain abandoned stations can be recolonized using an ability. Stations constructed using Terraforming & Station Construction can be recolonized, as well as some vanilla stations.
How many credits are required to recolonize a station.
How many crew are required to recolonize a station.
How much heavy machinery is required to recolonize a station.
How much metal is required to recolonize a station.
How much transplutonic metal is required to recolonize a station.
Set this to false to completely disable all Domain-tech content regardless of other settings.

Set this to false to disable Domain-tech crafting.

Domain-tech crafting allows the player to use Domain-era artifacts and story points to craft powerful special items that can usually only be obtained via exploring.
How many Domain-era artifacts are required to craft one easy special item.
How many Domain-era artifacts are required to craft one medium special item.
How many Domain-era artifacts are required to craft one hard special item.
How many story points are required to craft one special item.

Set this to true to enable the planet-killer device.

Please note that this feature is problematic from a balance and lore standpoint and may cause bugs and/or crashes. Use it at your own risk.

fieldName: Planet-killer device can destroy essential planets
fieldDescription:
Set this to false to prevent the planet-killer device from being used on planets marked as essential to story quests.

Using the planet-killer device on a story essential planet is guaranteed to cause bugs and/or crashes. This should only be used if the player has already completed all the story quests they intend to complete in the current save.

Set this to true to enable the Perihelion Project.

The Perihelion Project allows the player to construct a coronal hypershunt in a star system that meets certain requirements.
How many days are required to finish the Perihelion Project.

Set this to false to disable the Domain Archaeology building.

The Domain Archaeology building is an industry that produces Domain-era artifacts based on the level of ruins on the planet. DurationSettingModifier this to false will disable crafting, and buildings that require Domain-era artifacts will no longer require them.

fieldName: Replace techmining building on Agreus with Domain Archaeology
fieldDescription: Set this to false to prevent the techmining building on Agreus from being removed and replaced with a Domain Archaeology building.

fieldName: Add Domain-tech buildings to several colonies
fieldDescription:
Adds buildings that demand Domain-era artifacts to several vanilla colonies.

This includes: Genelab on Volturn, Limelight Network on Fikenhild, GPA on Ancyra, DAE demand on Cryosanctum on Nomios.

Set this to false to disable the Kletka Simulator building.

The Kletka Simulator is an industry that produces AI cores. The AI cores are sent to storage along with other items and ships the player receives each month.

fieldName: Kletka Simulator upkeep is based on temperature
fieldDescription: Set this to false to make the Kletka Simulator have a static upkeep instead of the upkeep cost being dependant on the temperature of the market it is located on.

fieldName: Kletka Simulator upkeep modifier can be suppressed along with the temperature
fieldDescription: Set this to true to make the Kletka Simulator's temperature based upkeep be suppressed if the temperature condition is also suppressed.

fieldName: Show production roll for industries that produce items
fieldDescription: Set this to true to show the production roll for industries that produce items, like Kletka Simulator, after the production chances in the tooltip.

Set this to false to disable the CHAMELEON building.

The CHAMELEON is a building that can slowly remove certain hazardous conditions from a market, such as a decivilized subpopulation.

fieldName: Limelight Network building can be constructed by the player
fieldDescription: Set this to true to allow the player to construct the Limelight Network building.

fieldName: Cryosanctum building can be constructed by the player
fieldDescription: Set this to true to allow the player to construct the Cryosanctum building.
Set this to false to prevent Cryosanctum buildings from demanding Domain-era artifacts.

Set this to false to disable construction of Domain-tech stable location structures.

This refers to the comm relays, nav buoys and sensor arrays that can be constructed at stable locations. The Domain-tech versions have more powerful effects.

fieldName: Relationship impact from upgrading stable location structures
fieldDescription: Upgrading sector-tech stable location structures controlled by another faction improves the player's relationship with that faction. This setting controls the magnitude of the improvement.

fieldName: Domain-tech stable location structure heavy machinery cost
fieldDescription: How much heavy machinery is required to construct a Domain-tech stable location structure.

fieldName: Domain-tech stable location structure metal cost
fieldDescription: How much metal is required to construct a Domain-tech stable location structure.

fieldName: Domain-tech stable location structure transplutonics cost
fieldDescription: How much transplutonic metal is required to construct a Domain-tech stable location structure.

fieldName: Domain-tech stable location structure Domain-era artifact cost
fieldDescription: How many Domain-era artifacts are required to construct a Domain-tech stable location structure.
Set this to false to disable construction of inactive gates.

fieldName: Main quest completion required to build gates
fieldDescription: Set this to false to allow construction of inactive gates before the main questline is completed.

fieldName: Player must have colony in system to build gates
fieldDescription: Set this to false to allow construction of inactive gates even if the player does not own a colony in the system.

fieldName: Market size required for inactive gate construction
fieldDescription: How large the player's largest colony in-system must be to meet the requirements to build an inactive gate.
How much heavy machinery is required to construct an inactive gate.
How much metal is required to construct an inactive gate.
How much transplutonic metal is required to construct an inactive gate.
How many Domain-era artifacts are required to construct an inactive gate.

Set this to false to disable construction of the Remnant Station building.

The Remnant Station is a type of orbital station. It has only one level instead of three and it spawns remnant patrols allied with the player to protect the colony.

Set this to true to enable construction of the Hydroponics building.

The Hydroponics building is an industry that can produce food without any farmland.

Set this to true to enable construction of the Cloning building.

The Cloning building is an industry that can produce harvested organs and increase colony growth.
